input: Sentence1: The police pulled Michael to the side of the road. Sentence2: When he took Michael's license, he noticed that it's outdated. Sentence3: Michael tried to run away. Sentence4: The police eventually caught up with him.
target: Michael ended up getting tackled.

input: Sentence1: It was summer and Beth was bored. Sentence2: She decided to gather the neighborhood kids to race. Sentence3: She went door to door gathering participants. Sentence4: The kids lined up at the end of the street to start.
target: Even though Beth didn't win she had a great time.

input: Sentence1: Rufus is late meeting his friends at happy hour. Sentence2: When he arrives, all of his friends are already there. Sentence3: Rufus decides he needs to get a beer and join them. Sentence4: He goes to the bar and orders one beer.
target: Rufus feels glad that he can finally join his friends.

input: Sentence1: Lynn told her friends they were going to sneak out. Sentence2: But sneaking back in was a problem. Sentence3: Her dad was in the kitchen. Sentence4: The girls climbed into the basement through an open window.
target: Her dad caught them and scolded them for sneaking out.

input: Sentence1: Jane wanted to be a nurse. Sentence2: She enrolled in all the prerequisites at school. Sentence3: She took her entrance exam. Sentence4: Jane sent in her application to nursing school.
target: Jane was accepted and extremely excited.

input: Sentence1: We went hiking a few weeks ago. Sentence2: After deciding to leave, we decided on a forest not too far from us. Sentence3: Once we got there, the weather was perfect! Sentence4: After setting out down the trail, we saw a snake!
target: We were scared!

input: Sentence1: I got detention for the first time in 12th grade. Sentence2: It was embarrassing because I never got in trouble before. Sentence3: I took the slip to my mom for her to sign. Sentence4: I sat in the room and read quietly.
target: I left the room with a load off my shoulders.

input: Sentence1: I was on vacation with my entire family. Sentence2: My niece had the worst constipation. Sentence3: We tried fiber gummy bears and miralax. Sentence4: But nothing would do the trick.
target: Finally when we got home, she got back on schedule.

input: Sentence1: Cindy loved recess but the one thing she hated was bullies. Sentence2: The mean girl Lisa would never let Cindy play with her. Sentence3: As a result, Cindy would cry everyday. Sentence4: Luckily the teacher saw and did something about.
target: Cindy no longer had to worry about any bullies.

input: Sentence1: Jorie went with her family to visit Anne Frank's home in Amsterdam. Sentence2: She read the book beforehand. Sentence3: She thought the home was quite small. Sentence4: Her mother cried while watching through the museum.
target: Jorie admitted it was a very emotional tour.

input: Sentence1: Amy was at her desk but she needed to use the bathroom. Sentence2: She knew the janitor was in the bathroom and had to wait. Sentence3: She walked swiftly to the bathroom when he was done. Sentence4: In a hurry she turned the corner and ran into her boss.
target: Amy was just happy the coffee spilled on her was cold.

input: Sentence1: Harry was promoted to the position of bank manager. Sentence2: His meticulous approach to his work won him many accolades. Sentence3: The head office got a tip Harry was embezzling money. Sentence4: The bank found no evidence to prove it, and let the matter drop.
target: Harry retired soon after to a private island.

input: Sentence1: Joy brought her favorite mug with here to the coffee shop. Sentence2: They filled it to the brim with fresh coffee. Sentence3: Joy drank her coffee while looking at her phone. Sentence4: When she was done she handed it to the store worker.
target: They cleaned her mug for her and gave it back.

input: Sentence1: Last weekend I wanted to buy some shoes. Sentence2: I needed a new pair from work so had to look for a place to go. Sentence3: I decided on the mall seeing as how they have a large variety. Sentence4: Once I got there, I quickly went to the store I had selected.
target: I found a perfect pair of shoes and bought them.

input: Sentence1: LeTosh was about to be in a reality show. Sentence2: She was so nervous and uneasy. Sentence3: On set, the producers flirted with her and touched her waist. Sentence4: She tried to act her role, but was bothered by the producers.
target: She decided to have dignity, quit the job and left the set.

input: Sentence1: Jennifer was hungry on a rainy day. Sentence2: She looked through her house, but didn't have much. Sentence3: Suddenly, she noticed a can on her shelf. Sentence4: She looked at it and it was chicken noodle soup.
target: Jennifer opened the can and began to eat.

input: Sentence1: Gina had gotten her phone back from a teacher. Sentence2: He had kept it 2 days. Sentence3: Her mother was becoming suspicious. Sentence4: Now she would be able to keep it secret that it was ever taken.
target: Gina's mother never found out that her phone was taken away.

input: Sentence1: Walter paid for a bouquet to be delivered to his wife. Sentence2: She was at work at the office all day. Sentence3: The delivery person got the name wrong. Sentence4: A different woman got the flowers.
target: Walter's wife thought it was funny when she found out.

input: Sentence1: Todd went to his kitchen to get a drink. Sentence2: He poured some water in a glass and went to his living room. Sentence3: He sat down on his couch and turned on the tv. Sentence4: While watching tv, Todd relaxed and knocked his glass over.
target: The glass shattered on the floor and Todd had to clean it up.

input: Sentence1: Jaris wanted to pick some wildflowers for his vase. Sentence2: He went to the state park. Sentence3: He picked many kinds of flowers. Sentence4: Little did Jaris realize that it was a national park.
target: Jaris got in trouble and apologized profusely.

input: Sentence1: Todd went to the night club by himself. Sentence2: His friends didn't want to go out to the club so he went alone. Sentence3: He arrived at 11 and the club was packed. Sentence4: Although nervous, he managed to meet a girl, Tina.
target: He bought her a drink, and took her home for a fun night.

input: Sentence1: There was a pizza store in a small town. Sentence2: The next month a competitor wanted to enter the pizza market. Sentence3: The company was called pizza man Dan. Sentence4: He tried for a year to break into the market.
target: He ended up failing and close his doors a year later.

input: Sentence1: My wife has today off from work. Sentence2: Our cat was very happy because of this. Sentence3: The cat usually stays in a bedroom all day. Sentence4: She waits for my wife to come home.
target: Today the cat sat in the living room with my wife.

input: Sentence1: My fridge was looking a bit empty. Sentence2: I made a grocery list of items I needed. Sentence3: I drove to the store and did my shopping. Sentence4: I paid and drove home.
target: When I got home, I felt better because I could restock my fridge.

input: Sentence1: Kelly went to a Celtics game yesterday. Sentence2: She loved going to games. Sentence3: The clock was ticking and time was running out. Sentence4: Thankfully the Celtics won.
target: Kelly jumped for joy.

input: Sentence1: Yesterday, I decided that I would take a trip to New Zealand. Sentence2: I wasn't sure how I would pay for it, but I knew I wanted to go. Sentence3: After looking through newspapers, I found a job as a dog walker. Sentence4: The family was rich and greatly overpaid me.
target: My plan to go to New Zealand had become possible.

input: Sentence1: Today was Zoey's school picture day. Sentence2: She tried to look as cute as possible. Sentence3: Then, she got her picture taken. Sentence4: When it came out weeks later, she was so upset.
target: Her hair looked horrible in the photo.

input: Sentence1: Dan was teaching his daughter to check her oil in her car. Sentence2: She watched as he did it once. Sentence3: She then attempted herself. Sentence4: She quickly yanked the stick out instead of slowly pulling.
target: Dan laughed as oil splashed all over her face and clothes.

input: Sentence1: Cole was given coal for Christmas as a gag gift. Sentence2: Cole was young and took it very seriously. Sentence3: Cole was well-behaved for months after that. Sentence4: Eventually Cole forgot about the incident.
target: Cole never got coal again.

input: Sentence1: My friend invited me to play rugby. Sentence2: I accepted his invitation. Sentence3: All of the other players were bigger than me. Sentence4: I was scared but I played the game anyways.
target: One of the players tackled me and my lower lumbar disc herniated.

input: Sentence1: Gina was using a restroom at a gas station. Sentence2: She went to wash her hands, but there was no soap. Sentence3: She looked in the cabinet under the sink hoping to find some. Sentence4: There was no soap there either.
target: So she had to settle for rinsing her hands off.

input: Sentence1: Judith was making spaghetti. Sentence2: She opened a jar of pasta sauce. Sentence3: Then, she went to pour it into a pot. Sentence4: Somehow, she missed the pot and sauce spilled across the stove top.
target: Judith quickly wiped the sauce up but it was all ruined.

input: Sentence1: Today was April Fools Day and everyone played pranks on each other. Sentence2: Jeff was sneaking towards Dan, who was sitting down. Sentence3: When Jeff turned around, And shouted. Sentence4: The chair ended up breaking when Jeff called.
target: Dan couldn't help but laugh.

input: Sentence1: Joe stopped for coffee on his way to work, as usual. Sentence2: He drank it all down as quick as always. Sentence3: But on this day he was still very sleepy. Sentence4: The coffee hadn't helped him at all!
target: Poor Joe didn't know the barista had given him decaf coffee!

input: Sentence1: I just read The House of Sand and Fog. Sentence2: I read it because it was mentioned in my local newspaper. Sentence3: The book is about an American woman fighting an Iranian immigrant. Sentence4: The immigrant bought the woman's house under odd circumstances.
target: The ending was very sad, with three deaths and two jail sentences.

input: Sentence1: Jolene joined the track team at school. Sentence2: She was the worst on the team, but she tried her best. Sentence3: After a long time, she started to get better. Sentence4: Eventually she was the best on the team!
target: Jolene was glad she worked so hard.

input: Sentence1: The zookeeper closed the zoo for the night. Sentence2: But he didn't check the rhino cage. Sentence3: It wasn't latched properly. Sentence4: The rhino escaped!
target: The news the next morning showed a rhino running rampant.

input: Sentence1: Yesterday Kim got a brand new blazer. Sentence2: To her delight, when she got to school everyone complimented her on it. Sentence3: The next few weeks, Kim saw that everyone was wearing the blazer. Sentence4: She felt happy to start a new trend.
target: Kim was glad people were inspired to imitate her.

input: Sentence1: Gina and her friend Tami were walking to their classroom. Sentence2: Down the hall Gina could see he bully who had tripped her. Sentence3: Gina tried to keep her composure. Sentence4: She took a deep breath and put on a weak smile.
target: Tami told the bully to get lost, and he looked intimidated.

input: Sentence1: Mary had a very solid idea what French food consisted of. Sentence2: She thought French food was just frog legs and snails. Sentence3: Her parents decided to take her to a French restaurant. Sentence4: Mary protested and though she would hate it.
target: Mary was surprised to learn French food was very diverse.

input: Sentence1: Rich and his friends went to see Garth Brooks in concert. Sentence2: There were so many people at the concert. Sentence3: They got some drinks and found their seats. Sentence4: Rich sang along to every song.
target: He thought it was the best concert ever.

input: Sentence1: My birthday was yesterday. Sentence2: To my surprise my friends planned a party for me. Sentence3: I could not believe it. Sentence4: The party was very fun.
target: It was the best birthday party ever.

input: Sentence1: Horace realizes that his closet has become cluttered with stuff. Sentence2: He decides he needs to thoroughly clean it one night. Sentence3: Horace cleans out all the old junk and papers from his closet. Sentence4: When cleaning the papers, he comes across an old photo that he loved.
target: Horace is happy that he cleaned out his closet.

input: Sentence1: James was very mad at his older brother. Sentence2: His brother had just yelled at James for losing his glasses. Sentence3: James knew that it was his fault, but didn't understand his brother. Sentence4: Why did he always yell at James?
target: James punched his brother in anger, which led to him being being beat.

input: Sentence1: Dave had wanted to travel to California his whole life. Sentence2: Dave worked hard and saved his money. Sentence3: Eventually he had enough money for a trip. Sentence4: Dave planned out his vacation.
target: Finally he was ready for his dream trip to California.

input: Sentence1: Jerry was walking across the street. Sentence2: He wasn't at a crosswalk and wasn't paying attention. Sentence3: A car hit him from the side. Sentence4: He wasn't hurt that bad.
target: He learned to always look and follow rules, though.

input: Sentence1: James needed a new pick up truck for work. Sentence2: He hauled wooden logs for a living. Sentence3: He searched all over on craigslist. Sentence4: Finally he found a red truck that he liked.
target: James was able to buy the car off the seller for a discount.

input: Sentence1: Gina and her friends were outside of the school library. Sentence2: They wanted to go inside. Sentence3: But the librarian was not in in the library. Sentence4: The girls weren't sure where she could be.
target: They decided to wait for her.

input: Sentence1: Mary's baby had been crying all night. Sentence2: She didn't know why so she checked his temperature. Sentence3: It looked really high so she figured he was sick. Sentence4: She ran out to the store and bought some medicine.
target: At home, she gave him some and he seemed to calm down a bit.

input: Sentence1: Dave was addicted to coffee. Sentence2: And he drank 3 cups one morning. Sentence3: But soon after, she felt incredibly anxious and stressed. Sentence4: He stayed in bed and skipped work.
target: Dave switched to decaf coffee.

input: Sentence1: The first day of school I walked there with two of my closest friends. Sentence2: We were all very nervous. Sentence3: When we got to school we checked the class list for third grade. Sentence4: All three of us were assigned to the same classroom!
target: We couldn't believe our luck.

input: Sentence1: Maggie and her parents were moving to a new town. Sentence2: Maggie was nervous because she didn't know anyone. Sentence3: As soon as she moved in, she went around introducing herself. Sentence4: She ended up making some friends.
target: Maggie liked the new town.

input: Sentence1: Sandy is Louie's mother. Sentence2: Louie is a puppy. Sentence3: A nice family adopted Sandy. Sentence4: They decided to adopt Louie too.
target: The dogs seemed happy to stay together.

input: Sentence1: I needed to take my dog for a walk. Sentence2: My neighborhood requires a leash. Sentence3: I looked through my house for the leash. Sentence4: I could not find it.
target: I decided to take my dog to the back yard.

input: Sentence1: One Friday night we all pitched in and got a huge pizza. Sentence2: My brother bit into a slice that had a piece of gum on it. Sentence3: Disgusted, we called the pizza place to complain. Sentence4: They came by our house and denied everything.
target: We ordered from another store.

input: Sentence1: Jim met Sam for the first time. Sentence2: Before they left each other, she gave him her Facebook URL. Sentence3: He tried to find her URL online. Sentence4: In addition, he also looked through her account.
target: He found that that she is a party animal based on her photos.

input: Sentence1: After a long day at school, Mandy was tired. Sentence2: She wanted to nap before her favorite show started. Sentence3: But, Mandy had to clean her room and do her homework. Sentence4: She finished just in time to watch the show.
target: But, Mandy fell asleep during the show.

input: Sentence1: David seen a job ad while on the school computer. Sentence2: He filled out the application and submitted it. Sentence3: Later that day, He is called by HR to come in for a interview tomorrow. Sentence4: Next day, David goes to his job interview which last 20 minutes.
target: After the interview, the company offered him the job and he accepted.

input: Sentence1: Leroy found an old Ford that he wanted to restore. Sentence2: He purchased it for five thousand dollars and took it home. Sentence3: He spent three years replacing broken or worn parts. Sentence4: He had it repainted jet black.
target: He was very proud of his beautiful car and all the work he had done.

input: Sentence1: Steven's final exam is an essay. Sentence2: It is due in two days. Sentence3: It has to be 10 pages long. Sentence4: Joe has only written 1 page.
target: Joe decided he better skip the party and write his paper.

input: Sentence1: Tommy trained hard to run his first 5K. Sentence2: During the race he felt frustrated when so many people passed him. Sentence3: When he heard his name called during awards he was shocked. Sentence4: He didn't realize they would do awards by age group.
target: He was proud to finish first by age but tenth overall.

input: Sentence1: Ned went on vacation in Peru. Sentence2: While there, he made plans to hike a mountain, to Machu Picchu. Sentence3: The mountain was incredibly steep, and Ned had trouble with the climb. Sentence4: The porters were used to climbing the mountain, and helped Ned climb.
target: Ned managed to make it to the top with the porter's assistance.

input: Sentence1: I took a long road trip last week. Sentence2: I drove four hundred miles in one day. Sentence3: I didn't have to but I just wanted to clear my head. Sentence4: I found out that I like long drives with music playing.
target: It's very peaceful and I'm going to do it more.

input: Sentence1: Sean was looking for a job. Sentence2: He was inside of a smoothie shop inquiring about a position. Sentence3: The manager interviewed him and it went well. Sentence4: He had one issue, Sean's red hair, identical to the uniform.
target: Sean promised that he would change his hair color and was hired.

input: Sentence1: Bob got drunk at the Christmas party. Sentence2: He decided to drive home under the influence of alcohol. Sentence3: Sure enough, he was stopped by the police. Sentence4: They police arrested Bob and sent him to jail.
target: Bob had to pay a fine and realize he should not drink and drive.

input: Sentence1: I used to be confused about my sexual preference. Sentence2: I liked guys and girls. Sentence3: Then, I dated a girl. Sentence4: I found out girls are crazy.
target: Now, I only like guys.

input: Sentence1: My girlfriend planned a picnic for us last weekend. Sentence2: It was a sweet gesture. Sentence3: We picked a nice area and set up a sheet and ate sandwiches. Sentence4: Unfortunately within minutes we were overrun by ants.
target: We got bit so much we had to go home early.

input: Sentence1: Tara had really bad back pain. Sentence2: She went to her doctor to get it checked out. Sentence3: Her doctor told her to improve her posture at work. Sentence4: Tara bought a brand new $500 office chair.
target: She no longer had any back pain with her improved seating position.

input: Sentence1: Leslie strove to stand up for his ideals. Sentence2: He was a natural leader of men. Sentence3: An underling poisoned half the people in the state with bad water. Sentence4: Leslie took responsibility despite having nothing to do with it.
target: He resigned and the underling now has Leslie's old position.

input: Sentence1: Sean's roommates notice that his clothes and bed start to smell. Sentence2: They tell him he needs to clean his laundry pretty soon. Sentence3: Sean protests at first, but finally he cleans his laundry. Sentence4: His roommates are grateful that Sean no longer smells as bad.
target: They tell him to never wait so long to do laundry again.

input: Sentence1: Ronald's daily routine was to read the newspaper. Sentence2: He honestly looked forward to sitting in his chair with his coffee. Sentence3: One day, the paper wasn't delivered and Ronald was very upset. Sentence4: Then, Ronald realized he could just read the news online on his phone.
target: Ronald decided to cancel his newspaper subscription.

input: Sentence1: Bob was daydreaming as he drove his car. Sentence2: A deer jumped out right in front of him on to the road. Sentence3: Bob's car slammed into the deer! Sentence4: The deer and Bob's front bumper were pulverized!
target: Bob was dazed and had a cut on his forehead!

input: Sentence1: Sophie started a new class today on painting. Sentence2: She was super excited when she went to school. Sentence3: In her new class she learned a lot on the first day. Sentence4: The teacher talked about colors, brushes, and different canvases.
target: Sophie couldn't wait for the rest of her class.

input: Sentence1: Helen lived in the state of Washington. Sentence2: Helen wanted to visit Canada. Sentence3: Helen's car broke down on the day of her trip. Sentence4: Helen decided it wasn't meant to be.
target: Helen stayed home instead and planned to go another day.

input: Sentence1: My boyfriend in high school was very romantic. Sentence2: One summer I was away at camp. Sentence3: He sent me a package of fortune cookies. Sentence4: He took out the fortunes and replaced them with reasons he loved me.
target: I really liked the package and the cookies.

input: Sentence1: I saw a water spot on my ceiling. Sentence2: I decided to go in the attic to investigate. Sentence3: It turns out my water heater was leaking. Sentence4: I tried to fix it myself.
target: I only made the problem worse so I gave up.

input: Sentence1: Bob spilt his tea on his pants during a business meeting. Sentence2: It looked like he peed his pants. Sentence3: Bob tried to give his presentation seated but the boss wouldn't allow. Sentence4: When he got up the boss demanded to know if he peed himself.
target: Bob was so flustered that he had a hard time denying it.

input: Sentence1: Hallie woke up. Sentence2: She was not feeling well. Sentence3: She got mad when she had to miss school. Sentence4: Hallie went back to sleep.
target: When she woke up she felt much better.

input: Sentence1: Maurice had been a big time drug dealer for Year's. Sentence2: His biggest pull was about to happen, as he smuggled LSD into Florida. Sentence3: However, the heat began to make him sweat. Sentence4: The 100 LSD hits began leaching into his skin.
target: Maurice is at a hospital now, and thinks he is a glass of orange juice

input: Sentence1: Sarah went with her friends to the water park. Sentence2: They paid for their tickets and got into their swimsuits. Sentence3: They waited in line for the biggest slide. Sentence4: They went down the slide and had a lot of fun.
target: They went back the next day.

input: Sentence1: In the restaurant kitchen, one of the cooks was making sauce. Sentence2: He dropped some of the sauce on the ground near him. Sentence3: Another cook walked by and slipped on the soup. Sentence4: The cook fell into a pile of flour sacks.
target: When he got up he looked like a ghost.

input: Sentence1: I took an art class once. Sentence2: I bought all the materials and went to class prepared. Sentence3: I worked hard every single day. Sentence4: On the last day of class, my teacher praised me for my improvement.
target: My hard work paid off!

input: Sentence1: Belle inherited a watch from her late grandmother. Sentence2: It meant a lot to her. Sentence3: One day, she went swimming. Sentence4: She left the watch by the pool side so it wouldn't get wet.
target: Someone stole her watch while she was swimming.

input: Sentence1: Sam had a crush on a shy girl at work. Sentence2: He told the girl she was pretty and smart. Sentence3: The shy girl asked Sam to meet her for lunch. Sentence4: At lunch she asked Sam if he had ever been in love.
target: Sam's heart felt crushed when the girl mentioned another guy.

input: Sentence1: Henry was playing a video game. Sentence2: It was particularly violent. Sentence3: He decided to pretend the blood was just raspberry jam. Sentence4: The game continued to be quite violent.
target: Henry turned off the video game when he felt it was too scary.

input: Sentence1: Liz's parents got a divorce. Sentence2: She wanted to live with her mom. Sentence3: Her mom requested full custody. Sentence4: The judge granted the request.
target: Liz and her mom live together happily.

input: Sentence1: One day I was walking through the woods. Sentence2: From several yards away, I saw a red snake. Sentence3: I froze immediately. Sentence4: I began to slowly walk backwards.
target: The snake bit me.

input: Sentence1: Beth worked through her lunch and was hungry. Sentence2: She was upset to see the cafeteria was closed. Sentence3: She ran downstairs to the hot dog vendor outside. Sentence4: When she got to her desk she realized she forgot mustard.
target: There was no time to go back so Beth ate the hot dog dry.

input: Sentence1: Yesterday i got my selfie camera in the mail. Sentence2: I opened up immediately. Sentence3: When I opened it I immediately started using it. Sentence4: It was great.
target: I then posted my photos onto social media.

input: Sentence1: Ritz was born in a large litter of 12 other puppies. Sentence2: When he was eight weeks old he was given away to a lovely family. Sentence3: They raised him well and he led a very happy life. Sentence4: Things changed one day for Ritz when his owner got cancer.
target: Ritz was orphaned and had to be sent to a shelter.

input: Sentence1: Tina drove her car to work. Sentence2: She listened to the radio as she drove. Sentence3: Suddenly, she heard a radio report of an auto accident. Sentence4: The accident was one mile ahead of where she was.
target: Tina wisely decided to go work on a different road.

input: Sentence1: Mark moved out of his parent's house into a town house. Sentence2: He soon discovered all the things that he now had to do himself. Sentence3: Paying for cable and internet was always something Mark's mom did. Sentence4: He shopped around and got both, adding a eighty dollar bill monthly.
target: Mark called his mom to thank her for all she has done for him.

input: Sentence1: Pamela purchased an antique urn at a garage sale. Sentence2: She thinks it would look nice with the decor in her home. Sentence3: When she got home she noticed that someone's ashes were in there. Sentence4: Pamela returned the urn.
target: Pamela received a full refund and a free urn for her troubles.

input: Sentence1: I love watching television. Sentence2: I have about six shows I love to watch. Sentence3: I tried watching all of them at once. Sentence4: That did not work out well and I got sick.
target: Now, I only watch one at a time.

input: Sentence1: Mario got up out of bed. Sentence2: Today was his wedding day and he already felt the butterflies. Sentence3: He shaved and showered happily. Sentence4: He got dressed and went to the church.
target: It was the best day of his life.

input: Sentence1: Ivy needed a belt because her jeans were too big. Sentence2: But she did not own one and her mom's were too small! Sentence3: She asked her dad for some help. Sentence4: He made her a belt of rope from his garage.
target: Ivy thought her new belt was functional and fashionable!

input: Sentence1: Mary's family was getting together for a holiday dinner at the club. Sentence2: Everyone was going to be there except for Mary's Grandfather. Sentence3: Mary was sad that the whole family would not be together. Sentence4: When she got to the club, she was surprised to see her grandfather!
target: Mary was so happy!

input: Sentence1: Every night I dreamt about a man in a blue box. Sentence2: He would travel through all space and time. Sentence3: One night, I dreamt that he wanted to take me with him. Sentence4: A sound wakes me in the middle of the night.
target: I head to the door and see the man in the blue box has come for me.

input: Sentence1: I cheered on Diana as she was playing the guitar. Sentence2: Her voice was in harmony with her sequence of guitar notes. Sentence3: However, a fly flew into her mouth. Sentence4: She immediately stopped to spit the fly out.
target: I ran across the audience to help her out.

input: Sentence1: Ronnie was riding his bike to work the other day. Sentence2: All of a sudden he hit a rock and fell. Sentence3: He wasn't hurt but his outfit was ruined. Sentence4: He kept going to work anyway.
target: Ronnie's boss commended him on his dedication.

input: Sentence1: Jim wanted a cat. Sentence2: He asked his mom if Santa could bring him a cat for Christmas. Sentence3: His mom said maybe, but cats were hard to carry in a sleigh. Sentence4: Jim tried to brace for disappointment.
target: But on Christmas morning, he got a tiny white kitten!

input: Sentence1: Mim was driving down the highway in a bad snow storm. Sentence2: There was so much snow, Mim pulled her car over. Sentence3: She noticed other people were doing the same. Sentence4: She got an emergency blanket from the backseat, and ate a snack.
target: Eventually it stopped snowing.

input: Sentence1: James likes to run marathons. Sentence2: James enrolled in the marathon a week early. Sentence3: James trained the entire week for the marathon. Sentence4: James ran the marathon successfully.
target: James established a new personal record marathon time.

input: Sentence1: Wendy bought some bath oil online. Sentence2: She misread the directions and applied it all over her body. Sentence3: To her horror, her skin had turned pink. Sentence4: She complained to the company promptly.
target: The company gave Wendy a full refund and apology.

input: Sentence1: Gina was due in the principal's office. Sentence2: But she didn't want to go there. Sentence3: She went to the library and grabbed a book. Sentence4: She tried to sit quietly and read.
target: But the librarian saw her, and sent her on her way.

input: Sentence1: My boyfriend and I decided we wanted to eat healthier. Sentence2: We thought that we could start buying more vegetables. Sentence3: We took a trip to the local farmer's market. Sentence4: There was an abundance of freshly harvested vegetables.
target: We purchased spinach, broccoli, and yams.

input: Sentence1: Tim sat at home hungry. Sentence2: He didn't feel like cooking. Sentence3: He wished he had a wife to cook him food. Sentence4: He sat on the couch and cried.
target: He then decided to order a pizza instead of crying.

input: Sentence1: My daughter watches television shows that are educational. Sentence2: Some of the shows are better than others. Sentence3: One in particular keeps her occupied the longest. Sentence4: This show lasts about twenty-five minutes.
target: Because of this show, her vocabulary has increased substantially.

input: Sentence1: Oliver took the salt from the kitchen. Sentence2: He brought it to his room. Sentence3: Then, he turned it upside down. Sentence4: Salt spilled everywhere.
target: His mom had to clean it up.

input: Sentence1: Fred passed by his favorite restaurant while driving home from work. Sentence2: He frequently ate there with his wife. Sentence3: So he decided to order something to go. Sentence4: Fred was annoyed how long the wait was.
target: So when he finally ate his burger at home, he was disappointed.

input: Sentence1: May wanted to give her mother a beautiful bouquet of flowers. Sentence2: She searched all over the house and couldn't find any. Sentence3: She went out to the yard and there were none. Sentence4: She finally decided to draw a bouquet for her mom.
target: Her mother broke down crying at the reception of the gift.

input: Sentence1: Chuck was driving his convertible to the store to buy fruit. Sentence2: A deer caused him to swerve off the road. Sentence3: He then ran into an apple tree. Sentence4: Apples rained down from the branches.
target: With his car full of apples he no longer needed to go to the store.

input: Sentence1: Mary had a credit card debt of over $2000. Sentence2: She wanted to pay it off. Sentence3: She cut off her unnecessary expenses such as going out. Sentence4: She saved all her money in a savings account.
target: Gradually, Mary was able to pay off her debt.

input: Sentence1: Simon was sound asleep dreaming of tomorrows baseball game. Sentence2: Suddenly there was a crash in the hallway. Sentence3: Simon jumped up, baseball bat in hand, to see what happened. Sentence4: He nearly scared his little sister to death.
target: She was bent over in the hall picking up the picture that had fallen.

input: Sentence1: When I saw Elena in person, I handed her a diamond necklace. Sentence2: She got excited and hugged me. Sentence3: The rest of the family decided to hand out their presents. Sentence4: My mom also asked Elena about the gift she bought for me.
target: Elena simply gave me a high five.

input: Sentence1: Joshi was a young buddhist monk. Sentence2: He had not yet achieved nirvana. Sentence3: Joshi decided to study buddhism every day and meditate. Sentence4: He studied and meditated for twenty years.
target: One day, Joshi finally achieved nirvana.

input: Sentence1: My neighbors are always playing loud music. Sentence2: It's not so bad during the day. Sentence3: They also play it at night, unfortunately. Sentence4: I finally asked them if they could lower the volume.
target: They agreed to lower the volume.

input: Sentence1: Ellen was at her doctor's office. Sentence2: She was about to find out the sex of her baby. Sentence3: She was really hoping for a boy! Sentence4: She held her breath as the doctor scanned her belly.
target: Her doctor confirmed it was a boy!

input: Sentence1: Jessica saved up for a haircut. Sentence2: She looked through some books to choose a style. Sentence3: Finally, she picked one. Sentence4: She handed the picture to the hairdresser.
target: The woman cut Jessica's hair.

input: Sentence1: Corey wanted a new video game for Christmas. Sentence2: His mom didn't like the video game. Sentence3: Corey begged his mother for it. Sentence4: Finally his mom bought it.
target: Corey was ecstatic to find the game under the tree.

input: Sentence1: Last week I accidentally overdrafted my account. Sentence2: A restaurant charged me too much by mistake. Sentence3: Afterward I made five more purchases. Sentence4: I had hundreds of dollars in overdraft fees.
target: My bank refused to reverse more than half.

input: Sentence1: Anna was in a film class. Sentence2: She wasn't getting along with her group and didn't know what to do. Sentence3: Her teacher recommended that she join a new one, one that he liked. Sentence4: She approached the group and asked if they needed any help.
target: Luckily, the accepted her warmly and she felt much better.

input: Sentence1: Gina's mother was not happy about bringing her a spare key. Sentence2: But Gina explained she wasn't very far from her home. Sentence3: Her mother calmed down when Gina explained it was only 5 minutes away. Sentence4: Gina stood near her car waiting for her mother.
target: She was relieved when she spotted her car at the stop light.

input: Sentence1: I've wanted a puppy since I was young. Sentence2: Yet, I still don't have a puppy. Sentence3: So, I decided to do something about  it. Sentence4: I went to the big box pet store.
target: I just bought the cutest one!

input: Sentence1: Josh was writing short stories for a researcher. Sentence2: The researcher was impressed by Josh's stories. Sentence3: The researcher decided to give Josh a bonus. Sentence4: Josh was happy that he got a bonus.
target: Josh used the bonus to repair his broken car.

input: Sentence1: Nick started at a new school today. Sentence2: He was looking for someone to sit with at lunch. Sentence3: None of the other children would let Nick sit with them. Sentence4: Lucy felt bad for Nick.
target: Lucy let Nick sit by her and eat.

input: Sentence1: Melvin did not have electricity where he lived. Sentence2: Candles were used to illuminate the dark. Sentence3: Melvin ran out of matches however. Sentence4: He couldn't go into town this dark out.
target: The darkness overcame him.

input: Sentence1: Our son turns 27 this week. Sentence2: We gave him money for an Xbox. Sentence3: He was going to combine the cash with a Best Buy gift card he had. Sentence4: He looked everywhere for his card and thought he lost it.
target: Luckily he found the card and was able to get his birthday gift.

input: Sentence1: Jimmy went to the local diner to get some breakfast. Sentence2: He couldn't decide whether he wanted bacon or sausage. Sentence3: He decided to get both. Sentence4: Jimmy left the restaurant with a huge heart burn.
target: He decided never to eat that much meat ever again.

input: Sentence1: Rufus has just enrolled in a new school and he has no friends there. Sentence2: At first he feels apprehensive and worried he won't meet anyone. Sentence3: However, a nice guy named Ralph introduces himself to Rufus one day. Sentence4: They realize that they are in the same Chemistry class.
target: They decide to be lab partners in their class together.

input: Sentence1: Tania wanted to be a cheerleader. Sentence2: She was at the auditions one day. Sentence3: One of the requirements was for her to cheer in a quiet room. Sentence4: She tried to, but it felt awkward and didn't sound good.
target: She didn't end up making the team.

input: Sentence1: Casey was dying her hair. Sentence2: She followed all of the steps very carefully. Sentence3: Finally, it was time to wash out the dye and see her new color. Sentence4: She looked in the mirror when she was ready.
target: Somehow she had messed up and her hair came out completely red.

input: Sentence1: Peter was excited to go to the Sanders rally in New Hampshire. Sentence2: As Peter entered the arena it was full of thousands of people. Sentence3: When Peter saw Bernie he cheered as loudly as possible. Sentence4: He felt thrilled to be there.
target: He couldn't wait to vote for him.

input: Sentence1: Julia had a lot of things to do that day. Sentence2: She had to run errands and then she had to clean the house. Sentence3: She left early in the morning. Sentence4: It took her six hours to get everything outside done.
target: When she got home she saw that her husband had done the cleaning.

input: Sentence1: My cat loves playing strings. Sentence2: One day, she saw a string hanging from one of my curtains. Sentence3: She pounced on it! Sentence4: Unfortunately, she completely tore them.
target: I had to buy a new set of curtains.

input: Sentence1: Jazmine decided to try online dating. Sentence2: None of the guys she met were very compatible with her. Sentence3: One day, she met a nice guy named Nick. Sentence4: They got along very well.
target: Now, they're best friends.

input: Sentence1: Jack and Diane has been together for 3 years. Sentence2: Jack met someone else. Sentence3: He broke up with Diane. Sentence4: Jack began dating Elizabeth.
target: Jack proposed to Elizabeth 6 months later.

input: Sentence1: Steven needed to shovel his driveway, but he couldn't find his shovel. Sentence2: He couldn't go to the store until he shoveled his driveway, though. Sentence3: Steven called his neighbor, and she brought him a shovel. Sentence4: Steven was very grateful to her for helping him out.
target: He shoveled her driveway, too!

input: Sentence1: I had just retrieved my marbles from Sally's house when it happened. Sentence2: Everything went very black and cold. Sentence3: I woke up the next day in the hospital! Sentence4: Sally's dad thought I was robbing his house.
target: So he hit me upside the head with a baseball bat.

input: Sentence1: Jane was driving to school. Sentence2: She picked up her friend. Sentence3: The friend kept distracting her. Sentence4: Jane wound up running a stop sign.
target: She crashed into a van.

input: Sentence1: Joe got fired from his job. Sentence2: He was sad. Sentence3: He needed money for bills. Sentence4: He called  up grant.
target: Grant loaned Joe some money.

input: Sentence1: Freddy decided to buy a new truck. Sentence2: He went to the used car lot. Sentence3: The car salesman showed him a beautiful red truck. Sentence4: Freddy bought the truck immediately.
target: Freddy now cruises around town in his new truck.
